qas.question: What area was Roman Tarraconensis language different from?
What language branch did Catalan share a history with?
What is Occitan a branch of?

context: There is evidence that, at least from the a.d. 2nd century, the vocabulary and phonology of Roman Tarraconensis was different from the <a0_0>rest of Roman Hispania<a0_0/>. Differentiation has arisen generally because Spanish, Asturian, and Galician-Portuguese share certain peripheral archaisms (Spanish hervir, Asturian/Portuguese ferver vs. Catalan bullir, <a1_0>Occitan<a1_0/> bolir "to boil") and innovatory regionalisms (Sp novillo, Ast nuviellu vs. Cat torell, Oc taurèl "bullock"), while Catalan has a shared history with the <a2_0>Western Romance<a2_0/> innovative core, especially Occitan.
